title: Daily Market Digest: Inflation Data Lifts Indices, AI Concerns Persist
subtitle: Friday, February 14, 2026

items.headline: U.S. Stocks Rebound as Inflation Cools, AI Disruption Weighs on Specific Sectors
items.summary: U.S. equities saw a positive turn today, halting a recent slide as an encouraging update on inflation eased bond market pressures. Major indices closed higher, with the S&P 500, NASDAQ, and Dow Jones Industrial Average all posting gains. However, underlying concerns about the disruptive impact of artificial intelligence continued to influence market dynamics, leading to significant movements in individual stocks and a divergence in sector performance.

items.headline: Applied Materials Surges on AI Investment Outlook
items.summary: Applied Materials ($AMAT) was a significant gainer, rising 8.6%. The company, a key player in chip and display manufacturing, reported stronger-than-expected quarterly profits and attributed its success to the 'acceleration of industry investments in AI computing.'

items.headline: Moderna Climbs After Strong Quarterly Results
items.summary: Moderna ($MRNA) saw its stock climb 6.6% today after the vaccine maker announced stronger results for the latest quarter than analysts had anticipated.

items.headline: DraftKings Falls on Disappointing Revenue Forecast
items.summary: DraftKings ($DKNG) experienced a notable decline, falling 12.8%. Despite reporting a profit for the latest quarter that topped analysts' expectations, the company provided a revenue forecast for the current year that fell short of market predictions.

items.headline: Adani Enterprises Ltd Continues Decline
items.summary: Adani Enterprises Ltd ($ADANIENT) shares dropped -3.40% today, trading at 2136.60 per share. This decline has spurred discussions within the investment community regarding the stock's future prospects.

items.headline: Inflation Slows More Than Expected, Calms Investor Nerves
items.summary: A new report indicated that inflation slowed last month by more than economists had expected, with U.S. consumers facing prices 2.4% higher overall than a year earlier. This positive economic data contributed to an easing of pressure in the bond market and provided a boost to stock prices today.

items.headline: Sector Rotation Amidst Ongoing AI Disruption Fears
items.summary: Fears surrounding AI disruption continue to reshape market leadership, with investors rotating towards more 'old economy' sectors perceived as less vulnerable. Utilities, Materials, Real Estate, Consumer Staples, and Energy sectors have shown relative strength. In contrast, Information Technology, Financials, and Communication Services experienced accelerating underperformance, reflecting investor concerns over AI's potential impact on their business models.

items.headline: Job Market Exceeds Expectations in January
items.summary: The U.S. job market showed stronger-than-expected improvement last month, with January payrolls beating forecasts and 130,000 jobs added. This indicates modest labor-market strength.

items.headline: S&P 500 CAPE Ratio Signals Historical Valuation Concerns
items.summary: The S&P 500 recently recorded a CAPE (Cyclically Adjusted Price-to-Earnings) valuation multiple last seen in 2000, suggesting the stock market has not been this expensive since the dot-com crash. Historically, CAPE ratios above 40 have correlated with modest declines over the next year and steeper losses over the next several years, although past performance does not guarantee future results.

items.headline: Anora Group Oyj Misses Earnings Estimates, Shares Decline
items.summary: Anora Group Oyj (HEL:ANORA) shares fell 4.8% this week after the company's latest full-year results. While revenues were in line with analyst predictions, statutory earnings significantly missed estimates by 75%, coming in at €0.08 per share.
